description.en: Main attention will be paid on recognition of cardiac arrest and on training of practical skills of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) on manikins. The students will be trained to perform different BLS simulation scenarios of common emergencies (bystander witnessed sudden cardiac arrest, respiratory arrest, seizures, drowning, car accident and severe trauma, foreign body in respiratory tract). After every simulation scenario debriefing will be held. Students learn to provide first aid for wounds, massive bleeding and bone fractures. Participation in practical sessions is mandatory.
description.et: Kursusel osutatakse põhitähelepanu baasteadmistele ja oskustele kliinilise surma tuvastamisel ning esmaste elustamisvõtete rakendamisel (sh koos AED kasutamisega). Praktilised harjutused sooritatakse mannekeenidel, millele järgneb tüüpiliste elustamise situatsioonülesannete lahendamine (südame äkksurm tunnistajate juuresolekul, hingamisseiskus, krambihoog, uppumine, liiklusõnnetus ja raske trauma, võõrkeha ülemistes hingamisteedes). Peale situatsioonülesande lahendamist toimub arutelu. Õpitakse osutama esmaabi välise verejooksu, haavade ja luumurdude korral. Praktikumides osalemine on kohustuslik.

objectives.en: To teach first aid and basic life support measures, so that student is able to provide first-aid as non-medical specialist.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on õpetada esmaabi võtteid, mida üliõpilane saab  tavakodanikuna (st mitte meditsiinitöötajana) rakendada hädasolijate abistamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: After completion of the course the student
- is familiar with the main causes of life threatening conditions and acute illnesses
learning_outcomes.et: - teab õnnetusjuhtumite ja äkkhaigestumiste peamiseid põhjuseid

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the principles of safety of lay rescuer and victim on the scene of accident, incl. person with suspected or confirmed COVID-19
learning_outcomes.et: - teab kuidas tagada sündmuskohal abiandja ja kannatanu ohutus (sh COVID-19 nakkuskahtluse korral)

learning_outcomes.en: - recognizes a patient in critical condition, incl. clinical death
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab hinnata ja tunneb ära kriitilises seisundis (sh kliinilises surmas) kannatanu

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to perform basic life support (BLS) for adults and children (incl. use of an AED)
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab õigeaegselt rakendada esmaseid elustamisvõtteid täiskasvanule ja lapsele (sh kasutada automaatset kehavälist defibrillaatorit ehk AED-d)

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to give first aid in life-threatening and potentially life-threatening conditions (foreign body airway obstruction, shock, disorders of consciousness, seizures, drowning, electric trauma, accidental hypothermia, heat illnesses, cardiovascular disease, poisonings, bites and stings, severe allergic reaction, bronchial asthma, emergency childbirth)
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab osutada esmaabi eluohtlike ja potentsiaalselt eluohtlike seisundite korral (võõrkeha ülemistes hingamisteedes, shokk, teadvushäired, krambid, uppumine, elektritrauma, juhuslik hüpotermia, kuumakahjustused, südamehaigused, mürgistused, loomade ja putukate hammustused, raske allergiline reaktsioon, bronhiaalastma ja äkksünnitus)

learning_outcomes.en: - in the case of wounds is able to stop bleeding and cover the wound with sterile bandage
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab haavade korral peatada verejooksu ja katta haav steriilse sidemega

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to give first aid in massive bleeding and bone fractures
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab osutada esmaabi traumahaigele ja rakendada esmaabivõtteid verejooksu sulgemiseks ja luumurdude lahastamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: Because of COVID-19 pandemic this year on practical sessions students will not be taught artificial ventilation by mouth method and by pocket mask. The focus of BLS education will be on quality of chest compression without and with an AED. The student has to be able to open an airway and to perform one or two-person Ambu bag-mask techniques for manikin ventilation.
learning_outcomes.et: Seoses koroonaviiruse levikuga ei õpetata sellel aastal üliõpilastele elustamise praktikumidel kunstliku hingamist suust-suhu meetodil, samuti pocket maski abil. Keskendutakse rindkere kompressioonide kvaliteedile ja varajasele AED kasutamisele. Üliõpilane peab oskama avada mannekeenil ülemised hingamisteed ja rakendada adekvaatset ventilatsiooni Ambukoti ja maski abil (ühe ja kahe inimese poolt teostatav ventilatsiooni tehnika).

notes.et:
Practical exercises will take place in a classroom D309, Puusepa 8 (always follow the study plan).
Practical session lasts 3 hours. In hospital rooms shoes exchanges are required. Outer garments should be left to the student cloakroom.

description.et: During penultimate practicum students perform written test. Written test consists of 47 questions. For each question, the answers given to select only one correct answer which gives one point (a maximum of 47 points for 47 questions). A passing score is at least 38 points or correct answers. When the written test is performed positively students are allowed to the last practicum for non-differentiated assessment of practical skills on the manikins.

Non-differentiated assessment has grade ``pass`` when BLS simulation scenario on the manikin is performed successfully. Two to three students have to perform one BLS simulation scenario that had previously been completed in practical sessions. The scenario must be resolved in real time. The lecturer evaluates ensuring safety, speed of response and adequacy of activities. During CPR, the quality of chest compressions and early use of an AED will be assessed. Interruption of chest compressions must be minimal. One and two-person techniques for Ambu bag-mask ventilation have to be adequate. The airway must be kept open and chest rise should be visible. The compression-ventilation ratio must be correct. Threshold criteria: students perform BLS simulation scenario adequately and are able to analyze their activities.

grade_preconditions.et:
Osalemine kõikides praktikumides.
During penultimate practicum students perform written test. At the end of this practicum teaching staff member assess written tests and inform students about their results. When the written test is performed positively students are allowed to the last practicum for non-differentiated assessment of practical skills on the manikins. If students fail written test they should perform it again at the prescribed times with other groups.``

grade_evaluation.et: Non-differentiated assessment has grade ``pass`` when practical tasks on the manikins are performed successfully.

description.et: Incidence and causes of accidents and illness. Emergency medical system in Estonia.  First aid management. Casualty assessment and activity. Asphyxia and expired air resuscitation.
Clinical and biological death. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation. Drowning. Electrocution. Shock. Hypothermia and heat illness.
First aid for cardiac diseases. First aid for poisoning. Animal and insect bites and stings. Allergic reactions. Bronchial asthma. Altered consciousness. Convulsions. Emergency childbirth.
Muscle, ligament and joint injuries. Fractures. Soft tissue injuries. Head and spinal injuries. Chest injuries. Eye injuries. Multiple trauma. Burns and cold injuries.
Cardiopulmonary resuscitation in special circumstances. First aid for management of critically ill patients. Choking.
First aid for trauma victims. Splinting. Dressings and bandages. Moving injured casualties
Cardiopulmonary resuscitation. First aid for management of critically ill patients. Emergency department. Written test.
Final assessment: scenario and practical demonstration of first aid knowledge`s, approaches and methods.
